Subhash Kantamneni Undergrad @ MIT

About Me Projects Coursework In the News

About Me


Hi, I’m Subhash! I'm an undergraduate at MIT studying Physics and Computer Science originally from Jupiter, Florida. I love working on projects that leverage computer science to solve physical problems to positively impact society; right now the projects that I’m most interested in contributing to are Nuclear Fusion, the Mars Expedition, and Autonomous Vehicles. Outside of my academics I love meeting interesting people, reading memoirs, teaching and mentoring, playing basketball and ultimate frisbee, traveling to foreign countries, and exploring nature.

Coding

Experienced with writing production-level code and testing strategies with Typescript and completed multiple Arduino projects in C.

Data Science

Years of project-based experience with Python data science libraries (MatPlotLib, NumPy, scikit-learn)

Featured Projects

NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory

  • Exoplanet Discovery ML Intern (Summer 2021)
  • Skills: Python, Data Simulation, Machine Learning, Statistics

Last summer I worked at NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory on the atmospheric analysis of exoplanets using random forest classifiers and other classical machine learning techniques. The Python code I wrote has since been deployed as a permanent addition to the atmospheric analysis pipeline.

Abstract Presentation Slides

Korean Teaching Outreach

  • Skills: Communicating over Language Barriers, Leadership

This past January I lived in South Korea as part of a STEM teaching team that worked with disadvantaged middle school students in Seoul. I codeveloped Arduino projects to introduce programming in addition to ideating engineering projects like catapult design and cardstock rollercoaster creation to illustrate physics concepts and spark the students' interests in science.

MIT Global Teaching Labs
